metadata.title: CVE-2016-6303 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the MDC2_Update function in crypto/mdc2/mdc2dgst.c inOpenSSL before 1.1.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(out-of-bounds write and application crash) or possibly have unspecifiedother impact via unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6303` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.4
openssl - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.4').
